prefix: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in literature would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in literature would. What is the hundreds digit of $2011^{2011}$?
gpt_response:
To determine the hundreds digit of $2011^{2011}$, we must first consider how the number will be represented when raised to the 2011th power. Since we are only interested in the hundreds digit, we can ignore the other digits and focus on the last three digits of the number.

When calculating the last three digits of $2011^{2011}$, it is important to note that the hundreds digit will only be affected by the hundreds digit of the base number, 2011. In this case, the hundreds digit of 2011 is 0.

Since the hundreds digit of the base number is 0, the hundreds digit of any power of 2011 will also be 0. Therefore, the hundreds digit of $2011^{2011}$ is 0.
